Topic.Title: Ask yourself - Are you better off now...

Message.Msg: We were at the edge of an economic abyss in 2008 on step removed from a second great depression. Since then the stock market is 75% higher. Four million American's are back at work. Unemployment dropped from 10% to 8%. More American's now have health coverage. American's are benefitting from stimulus programs that cut their taxes. The auto industry almost went under four years ago and now are in robust health. Hundreds of thousands of auto workers are still employed. Senior citizens have better Medicare than four years ago. The drug benefit doughnut hole is being closed. We ended the war in Iraq and killed Osama bin Laden. Women can now count on being paid on a par with men for the same job. Corporate profits are the highest ever. Housing is recovering. Many homeowners are no longer under water. Interest rates are the lowest in our lifetimes. Home mortgages are more affordable than ever. So yes, America is much better off than four years ago.

In France near the now German, and Swiss border I visited an old castle, and walled city. I speculated back to the day when the Royal probably said I am your leader, and ruler. I am also your protector, you go ten kilometer to the Northwest, ande they are not like us. The same is true when you travel to the East. Watch out my people. Why, they even speak a different language , and worship an idol. Yet, do not worry if danger comes, return here, and I will protect you. Who, was protecting who I ask?

Message.Title: No wonder the middle class is shrinking
Message.Msg: all the money that they spend on entertainment that support celebrities lavish lifestyles. Take democrats Brad Pit and Angelina Jolie for instance. How many of you can build and admusement park for your children? ------ THERE’S one way to avoid hours queueing at theme parks – build your own like Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie. The Hollywood couple are finalising plans for a huge eco-friendly playground as a gift to their six-strong brood. They decided to go for the project in the grounds of their chateau in the South of France after last September’s visit to Legoland in Windsor, Berks, was cut short due to security concerns in the camp. A source said: “Brad and Ange felt really bad having to drag the kids home early when they were at Legoland last year. But if their bodyguards said there were too many people then they had no choice. “Their eldest son Maddox asked if they could build something similar at the house in France. They were already getting a new pool so they decided it was a great idea.” But unlike Michael Jackson’s Neverland, most of the park will be underground — with turf on top. It will be powered by sunlight, using panels in the roof and the water will be recycled. --------- This is only one example of celebrity extravagance. -------- So the next time celebrities promote the demoncratic socialist agenda and want everyone else, except those 47 percent that do not need to pay federal income taxes, to pay more taxes they need to pay more themselves. I propose a windfall profits tax on all celebrities, sports or otherwise, since we all pay a bit to support their lifestyles in one form or another anyway. Why shouldn't they? An actor making $2 million an episode for sitcoms like Seinfeld or Two and a Half men make more within that 30 minutes than anyone in the middle class will make in a lifetime! --------- And sports players: --------- Take a MLB player making $30 million a year for example. The average number of at bats per game is 3.3. --------- 3.3 x 162 = ~ 534.6 at bats per season 30,000,000 / 534.6 = ~ $56116.72 per at bat and they are lucky to be succesful one third of the time. Think about that the next time your favorite sports teams want to go on strike! --------- My point is, anyone of these fortunate extraordinary wage earners who politic for the raising income taxes on those squeezed between the haves and have nots should pay more themselves. At the very least lower the cost of the price for going to the movies or a game. Geesshhh! These people have enough money collectively to pay for all their beloved social programs.

Topic.Title: No wonder the middle class is shrinking

Message.Msg: Eva Longoria Parker: TV’s 4th Richest Lady by nocheLatina 09.23.2010 Share digg No wonder this Desperate Housewife is always smiling. According to Forbes, Eva Longoria Parker is one of TV’s top earning women. Coming in at fourth place and earning $12 million this past year alone, Parker beats comedian Tina Fey and “Desperate Housewives” co-star Marcia Cross. Sadly, she’s the only Latina on the list. In case you’re wondering, Ellen DeGeneres holds the number one spot. Sorry Tyra, you didn’t bank this time!

How he plans to harness all this anger, so he can be re-elected is amazing to many. I, and I'm sure many others, who grew up in the 60's, loved watching Daniel Boone, and many other Patriotic shows. I love history, and hold those brave defenders of The Alamo in high esteem. Taking cheap shots at these early Heroes, and claiming credit for taking out Been Hiding (from our present ones), shows the lack of character of this President.

Topic.Title: Paul Ryan`s Black college sweetheart

Message.Msg: We in America live in a Social Democracy. No, we don't. We live in a democratic, Constitutional republic, with decidedly market values. Social democrats (as in European Social Democratic parties) believe in an eventual evolution to Socialism (democratic ownership of industries). This is not America. Not at all. The US Democratic party isn't even close to European Social Democrats.

Topic.Title: Why President O used Greek Columns

Message.Msg: Ancient Greece is the intellectual source of Western democracies. Greek columns and architecture have long been symbols of enduring democratic institutions. The US Capital Building, the White House, all based on ancient Greek architecture. Leave it to a tea partier to cheapen these enduring symbols of Western freedom. You just don't understand your country, or your Constitution. You think you do, but you haven't a clue.
